column1: The Echoriath formed a natural circle of rock
column2: enclosing the valley later called Tumladen
column3: within which lay the Elves city of Gondolin. A hidden ravine provided the main access through the Echoriath — a way guarded by seven gates.

column1: Maeglin prospected in the northern part of the Echoriad and found diverse and abundant metals.  From his mine
column3: he found hard iron that he prized.

column1: When Fingolfin died the eagle Thorondor carried his body to a mountain top north of Gondolin.  Turgon
column3: came and built a Fingolfins Cairn over his body that no Orcs dared to approach.  Also in the aftermath of the Dagor Bragollach Húrin and Huor were the first men to enter Gondolin
column4: but they did not traverse the hidden ravine to reach the city - instead they were borne aloft by the eagles of Thorondor over the Encircling Mountains.  Later they departed in the same manner and thus could not reveal the passage into Tumladen (and swore oaths to not reveal the valleys location).

column3: eventually and inadvertently revealed the location of Turgons realm to Morgoth.  Húrin came to the Encircling Mountains and cried out for Turgon to hear him in his hidden halls. column1: The host of Morgoth came to Gondolin
column2: pouring over the Echoriad from the north and north east.  All would have died within the city but that Idril had made a secret tunnel.  She and Tuor led the remnants of the people of Gondolin out by this route and then they climbed into the mountains to the north
column3: by the perilous pass known as the Cirith Thoronath.  The refugees were attacked by Orcs and a Balrogs.  While eagles dispersed the Orcs
column4: Glorfindel fought with the Balrog upon a pinnacle of rock and both fell into the nearby abyss.  Like Fingolfin
column5: Thorondor came and brought Glorfindels body up to the refugees
column6: who buried him in a mound of stones beside the path.  The people could then proceed with their escape
